title: ICE Nominee Vote Delayed in Senate Over Abuse Allegation
sub_head: Ed Gonzalez’s nomination to run Immigration and Customs Enforcement stalled after a GOP senator noted an allegation of domestic abuse against him, which he denies
body:
WASHINGTON— Senate Democrats delayed a vote on Harris County, Texas, Sheriff Ed Gonzalez to serve as President Biden’s director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement after an allegation of domestic violence against him surfaced.
The allegation came in a letter from Sen. James Lankford (R., Okla.) this week, which asked Democratic leadership to delay Mr. Gonzalez’s vote to allow the claim to be investigated.
